subject: Re: [junit] Question of strategy but ...
msgSnippet: I also had the feeling to spend useless time... But it s the feeling one has when doing XP for the first time... ... Thomas, ... From: J. B. Rainsberger To:
messageBody:
I also had the feeling to spend useless time...
But it's the feeling one has when doing XP for the first time...
:-D
 
Thomas,
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: J. B. Rainsberger
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2001 7:49 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Question of strategy but ...

Thomas:

Different people work at different levels of "extreme". For me, I prefer to
throw away code that doesn't work and try again. I write a test. When I am
confident the test is correct, I write the code to make it pass. If the code
I write does not make the test pass and I do not already know the problem, I
throw the code away and try again. This minimizes debugging time. I find
this useful.

===========================================
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services Inc.
Software development with Java and Extreme Programming
